results.title: The Audition
results.creator_credit: Counterpoint Films and C B Wismar
results.brief_description: A young man comes into a seemingly empty theatre for an audition. He is not given a script but it is clear to the invisible director that he can portray surprise & anger can he portray love? Understanding? Pity? Concern? An allegorical tale of life, the young man it appears is the director as well.

results.title: The Au Harem D'archimede = Tea in the harem
results.brief_description:
“The narrative centers on the adventures of a couple of eighteen-year-olds, Madjid, a Beur and Pat, his illiterate French friend. However, the loose episodic structure of the narrative, covering a week or so in the lives of people living on the ironically named Flowers Estate, allows other stories to be intercalated, particularly that of Josette, a single mother who loses her job and is driven to attempt suicide, and Malika, Madjid’s mother, who not only holds her own family together, but also provides support for other women on the estate who are unable to cope. The film is primarily interested in exploring Madjid’s conflicts of identity, torn between the (unrealistic) expectations his mother has of him as an Algerian and his experiences on the streets of Paris with Pat.” Reference: Carrie Tarr. Questions of identity in Beur cinema: from ‘Tea in the Harem’ to ‘Cheb’. Screen 34:4 (Winter 1993).Awards: Prix Jean Vigo 1984.

Credits: Producer, Michele Ray-Gavras ; director, Mehdi Charef ; writer, Mehdi Charef ; photography, Dominique Chapuis ; music, Karim Kacel
Cast: Kader Boukhanef, Remi Martin, Laure Duthilleul, Saida Bekkouche, Nicole Hiss.

results.brief_description: Shows important contributions to the peaceful uses of nuclear energy. No other credits available.

results.title: The Atomic Cafe
results.creator_credit: Archives Project Production Co, Kevin Rafferty, Jayne Loader and Pierce Rafferty
results.brief_description: A painstakingly researched and brilliantly edited compendium of pro-nuclear propaganda from American newsreels, ‘educational’ material, military footage, advertisements, TV shows and pop songs. This was the Cold War at its most icy and all-pervasive, and no area of American popular culture seems to have escaped from its bitter ideological grip. This veritable flood of bizarre, horrifying and often ludicrously comic images is counterpointed on the soundtrack by an array of equally extraordinary songs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Archives Project Production Co, Kevin Rafferty, Jayne Loader and Pierce Rafferty

results.title: The Atom: a closer look
results.creator_credit: Corporate Productions and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live-action to illustrate the history of atomic theory, the structure of the atom and its nucleus, how nuclear energy is generated, radiation and the problems of nuclear waste disposal. Although basically factual, the program stresses the fact that the atom is neither good nor evil, and that it is man’s responsibility to decide whether atomic power will either create or destroy. Made pre Chernobyl but an excellent introduction to atomic theory. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Atom and industry
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Warren P. Everote
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how radio-isotopes are providing new techniques of measurement and quality control in a wide variety of industries. Illustrates the following; radio-active “tagging” or identification of batches of crude oil in the petroleum industry; measurement of wear in petrol engines by using radio-active piston rings; measurement and control of thickness of materials produced in sheet form; testing for flaws in casting.

results.title: The Atom and archaeology
results.creator_credit: Handel Film Corporation and Peter Mertens
results.brief_description: Shows how nuclear and radiation techniques, such as carbon-14 dating, thermoluminescence, atomic fingerprinting, and radiography, have helped archeologists discover new facts about the past. Hitherto impenetrable barriers of time are broken, and new data about ancient civilisations revealed. Pioneer work in progress at leading research centres in the USA is shown.

results.title: The Atlantic community: introducing Turkey
results.creator_credit: Europa Telefilm, North Atlantic Treaty Organization and Vittorio Gallo
results.brief_description: The third largest country in NATO, Turkey holds a geographical position of great strategic importance. In less than 40 years since the social and economic revolution begun by Kemal Ataturk, Turkey has made rapid progress in industry and in the raising of her living standards.

results.title: The Atlantic community: introducing the United States
results.creator_credit: News of the Day and North Atlantic Treaty Organization
results.brief_description: Describes the country and the people of the United States - geographical features, historical development and achievements, economic life, occupations of the people, and social customs. Explains the role of the United States in NATO.

results.title: The Atlantic community: introducing the United Kingdom
results.creator_credit: World Mirror and North Atlantic Treaty Organization
results.brief_description: A survey of the United Kingdom as a major member of NATO, showing her expanding industries, her military strength, her highly mechanised agriculture, and her progressive social legislation; and sitting side by side with these the unchanging beauty of her countryside and her love of the best in her past history and traditions.
